resources.string: Accessibility service for Key Mapper needs to be enabled in order to monitor long-press of the volume buttons and perform the associated mapped actions (i.e.: by default, when you long-press Volume Down for more than 750ms ReconQuest will launch). Click events, as reported in the Privacy Policy outlined by the original developer (which can be found in the “About” section of Key Mapper), are temporarily stored on your Oculus Quest while they occur, but they are promptly erased, never collected or permanently saved.

When you click \"record trigger\", you have 5 seconds to press the keys/buttons which will trigger the action. Your trigger will be added after the 5 seconds. Press \"clear\" to clear the keys you have already typed. If a button isn\'t detected here, the device vendor is probably blocking accessibility services from seeing it. Therefore, it can\'t be remapped.
Key Mapper is performing an action…
You are all set! Have fun using ReconQuest!
Key Mapper is active but still missing “Do Not Disturb” permission. “Fix” this!
On the Oculus Quest some of this native commands may result in odd behaviours. If you ever get stuck, try clicking multiple times the Home button on the Oculus Touch Controller to return to the UI
Click the key on the keyboard which you want to be entered. \n\nIMPORTANT! This will only work if you have selected the Key Mapper keyboard. This action is best used with a hardware keyboard.
IMPORTANT! This will only work if you have selected the Key Mapper keyboard. This action is best used with a hardware keyboard.
Type some text you want to be inserted when you perform this action.
Type a url which you want to be opened. The http://, https:// or www. isn\'t required.
Exception in onKeyEvent. Look in logcat.
Once you have enabled the device admin, you must DISABLE it if you want to uninstall the app.
Can\'t find the Accessibility settings page
Are you sure you want to leave?
Make sure Bluetooth is turned on and you have paired devices. Then try again.

When you tap \"OK\", you will be taken to Settings. In the Settings, scroll to the bottom and tap "Enable Root Features" so you can use root features/actions. If you know your phone isn\'t rooted or you don\'t know what root is, you can\'t use features which only work on rooted devices.
Can you please describe the issue you are having in the email, otherwise I can\'t help you. Thanks!
Long pressing only works for physical volume and navigation buttons. If you enable it for other keys, the keys won\'t work when they aren\'t long pressed.
The Key Mapper keyboard is designed to be used with a hardware keyboard, which is why it doesn\'t have a GUI. You can\'t use your preferred virtual keyboard while the Key Mapper keyboard is chosen.

To grant Key Mapper WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission, enable "root features" in the settings if your device is rooted. If your device isn\'t rooted, go to the Help page and follow the guide on how to use a PC/Mac to grant permission.

To grant Key Mapper WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission, enable "root features" in the settings if your device is rooted. If your device isn\'t rooted, go to the Help page and follow the guide on how to use a PC/Mac to grant permission.

Your device doesn\'t seem to have an accessibility services settings page. You can enable the accessibility service by giving the app WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission. After you tap \'okay\' a popup will guide you how to do it.
Tap to start the accessibility service.
Tap to start showing the keyboard again.
How long in milliseconds should a button be pressed for it to be detected as a long press. Default is 750ms.
How long in milliseconds to vibrate for if vibrating is enabled for a remap. Default is 1ms.
Show a persistent notification to allow you to pick a keyboard.
Show a persistent notification which starts/pauses your remaps and has a link to start/stop the accessibility service.
When a Bluetooth device you have chosen connects or disconnects, the keyboard picker will show automatically. Choose the devices below.
Show a toast message when you perform an action
A little message will popup when you perform an action.

Enable logging of important events inside the app so it is easier for the developer (or you) to debug any issues you are having with the app. The app will log some potentially sensitive information, such as when and which keys are being pressed so disable this once you have finished logging. The log will never leave your device without your permission and it can\'t be read by another app or you in a text editor. It will disappear if you uninstall the app. A button to see the log will appear in the menu on the home screen. From here you can delete the log and send it to the developer if you need.
Show a message when an error is encountered in the app
A message will be shown on the screen prompting you to log it when the app encounters an error it is aware of.

The Key Mapper keyboard will be automatically selected when a chosen bluetooth device is connected. Your old keyboard will be automatically selected when the device disconnects. There may be a 5-10 second delay after disconnecting your device for the keyboard to change.

Enable this if you want to use features/actions which only work on rooted devices. Key Mapper must have root permission from your root-access-management app (e.g Magisk, SuperSU) for these features to work. Only turn this on if you know your device is rooted and you have given Key Mapper root permission.
Show a toast message when performing an action fails
A little message will popup when an error is encountered while performing an action.
These options will only work on root devices! If you don\'t know what root is or whether your device is rooted, please don\'t leave a poor review if they don\'t work. :)
These options are only enabled if Key Mapper has WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission. There are instructions to grant it in the Help page.

In order for Key Mapper to work on your Oculus Quest, you have to enable its accessibility service. Tap the “FIX” button to load the Accessibility settings menu, select “Key Mapper” and flip the toggle to enable access, then press B or Y (twice) on the Oculus Touch controller to come back to this screen and continue
You can only record a trigger if the accessibility service is enabled.

Dear ReconQuest user, these are the last steps to complete the installation. Each slide that follows has a button to launch an application or a system setting that requires your input. To tap a button on screen, press the A or X button on your Touch Controller. When you are done configuring a given application or setting, press the B or Y button (multiple times if necessary) on your Touch Controller to return to the slides and continue to the next one. Every slide contains the gist of what you are required to do, but you should refer to the installation video for a complete guide

Activate your license, disable all unnecessary settings. Open AutoLaunch, then click Activate License to be prompted to browse for a file Your license, uploaded by the Toolkit during the pre-install, is located in /sdcard/Download/ (the file picker should default to that location) Select “AL-License.txt” to validate it (internet connection will be REQUIRED during the process). Please refer to the installation video for full details

Activate your license, keep the current power profile (when prompted on exit), disable all unnecessary settings. Open AutoTools, then click Activate License to be prompted to browse for a file. Your license, uploaded by the Toolkit during the pre-install, is located in /sdcard/Download/ (the file picker should default to that location). Select “AT-License.txt” to validate it (internet connection will be REQUIRED during the process). On exit, select CANCEL when prompted “Give it access to ignore Doze”. Please refer to the installation video for full details
Allow AutoTools to Modify System Settings

AutoTools requires permission to “Modify System Settings” in order to perform some special tasks, like turning OFF Location and Bluetooth during boot. Tap the “GRANT” button below to load the “Modify System Settings” menu, flip the toggle to grant permission, then press B or Y on the Oculus Touch controller to come back to this screen and continue.

Activate your license, restore data from backup, activate/deactivate profiles, keep the current power profile (when asked on exit), disable all unnecessary settings. Open Tasker. Please refer to the installation video for full details

Create a profile with the details of your Server, configure settings. Open Remote Launcher, then click the “Add Server button”. Fill in the Name, IP, Port and Password of your server and save. Assuming the server is running on your PC, the ReconQuest scripts will populate the list in the Client. Please refer to the installation video for full details
Accept TOS and keep the current power profile (when prompted on load). Open SecureTask, then AGREE to the TOS and select NO to “Ignore Battery Optimization”

The last 2 slides will help you setup Key Mapper. It has been specifically modified to work on the Oculus Quest, therefore it differs from the version provided by its original developer. Any original Key Mapper option that is not relevant on the Oculus Quest has been removed. If you encounter any issues, please refrain from contacting the original developer, but notify the developer of ReconQuest instead!

In order for Key Mapper to monitor your clicks and perform the associated mapped actions on your Oculus Quest, you have to enable its “Accessibility service”. When that is the case, by default, a long press (>750ms) of the Volume-(Down) button will launch ReconQuest. To enable it, tap the “GRANT” button below to load the Accessibility settings menu, select “Key Mapper” and flip the toggle to enable access, then press B or Y (twice) on the Oculus Touch controller to come back to this screen and continue.

Key Mapper needs “Do Not Disturb” permission granted. When denied, the Volume button mapped to launch ReconQuest will cease to provide its regular functionality (i.e.: assuming the default configuration is left untouched, you would no longer be able to use the button to decrease the volume as well). This holds true whether your Oculus Quest is running in “Do Not Disturb” mode or not. Tap the “GRANT” button below to load the “Do Not Disturb” permission menu, flip the toggle to grant permission, then press B or Y on the Oculus Touch controller to exit the menu thus completing the installation of ReconQuest!
You must have at least one trigger
The shortcut must have a title!
You must choose the Key Mapper keyboard for this action to work!
Can\'t find the shortcut. Is the app installed or enabled?
You need to grant Key Mapper permission to modify system settings to use this action.
This action is only supported up to Android %s
Can\'t find the keyboard settings page!
Key Mapper needs to be a device administrator to use this action!
Key Mapper doesn\'t have permission to use that shortcut.
The app needs permission to change the Do Not Disturb state!
This action needs permission to read the phone state!
Can\'t find the WRITE_SETTINGS permission page!
No compatible app is found to send feedback.

Click the “FIX” button to grant Key Mapper “Do Not Disturb” permission. The mapped Volume buttons of your Oculus Quest will not perform their regular function otherwise (this would be the case even when your Oculus Quest is not in “Do Not Disturb” mode)!
Do Not Disturb Permission granted! Your Oculus Quest volume buttons will always perform as intended!
Can\'t find the Do Not Disturb access permission settings!
Key Mapper encountered an error! Try to reproduce the error, enable logging to see what happened.
Key Mapper encountered an error! Look in the Log.
No app can be found to open that url
Maximum number of cameras in use!
Key Mapper will not work on your Oculus Quest if its Accessibility service is disabled! Tap the “FIX” button to enable the service
Accessibility service is enabled. If you have already granted Key Mapper “Do Not Disturb” permission, you are all set!

The Keyboard IME needs to be enabled to map actions like “Keycode”, “Key” or “Text” Enable only if you plan to use these kinds of actions (and you know what you are doing!) The default ReconQuest configuration does not need this “FIX”
The keyboard must be enabled and selected for some of your actions to work. “FIX” this on your Oculus Quest only if/when you intend to map actions like “Keycode”, “Key” or “Text”!
This device has no enabled input methods!
You have not enabled Accessibility service for Key Mapper on your Oculus Quest. Please “FIX” this!
You can\'t move to the end of the text in this field!
Battery optimisation settings not found! If it exists, open it manually.
error: Can\'t find a label for this option \"%s\"
Not all media apps support fast forwarding. E.g Google Play Music.
Not all media apps support rewinding. E.g Google Play Music.
